article.headline: Kroger will require all shoppers wear masks, starting July 22
article.body: Kroger Co. KR, +0.46% on Wednesday said it will require all shoppers wear masks at its stores, starting July 22. "We are taking this extra step now because we recognize additional precautions are needed to protect our country," the nation's largest supermarket chain said in a statement. Kroger is the latest major retailer to adopt such a policy as cases of coronavirus surge in the U.S., where the number of deaths has spiraled to more than 135,000. Previously, Walmart Inc. WMT, +1.00% said it will change its mask policy to require customers to wear them when shopping at Walmart and Sam's Club nationwide starting July 20. Best Buy Co. Inc. BBY, +1.45% and Starbucks Corp. SBUX, +0.53% started requiring consumers nationwide wear masks on July 15.
